trans-unit.source: This is the basic Hello World sample for native output.
trans-unit.target: This is the basic Hello World sample for native output.

trans-unit.source: It demonstrates how you build a native application using .NET Core on your platform: Linux, Mac, or Windows.
trans-unit.target: It demonstrates how you build a native application using .NET Core on your platform: Linux, Mac, or Windows.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can build a native images for any suported platform only from that platform.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can build a native images for any suported platform only from that platform.

trans-unit.source: .NET Core does not support cross-compiling for supported platform.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core does not support cross-compiling for supported platform.

trans-unit.source: To build and run the sample, type the following three commands:
trans-unit.target: To build and run the sample, type the following three commands:

trans-unit.source: installs all the dependencies for this sample into the current directory.
trans-unit.target: installs all the dependencies for this sample into the current directory.

trans-unit.source: The example shows the Windows path.
trans-unit.target: The example shows the Windows path.

trans-unit.source: Replace `win10-x64` with your platform's RID from the list of [supported RIDs](../../../../docs/core/rid-catalog.md).
trans-unit.target: Replace `win10-x64` with your platform's RID from the list of [supported RIDs](../../../../docs/core/rid-catalog.md).
